procedure.title: piston - con rod assembly removal operation
Piston - con rod assembly removal operation

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid starting a crack of the conrod, never use a sharp point or an engraving tool to mark the conrod bearing caps. Use an indelible marker pen.
reusenote.para: To avoid starting a crack of the conrod, never use a sharp point or an engraving tool to mark the conrod bearing caps. Use an indelible marker pen.

procstep.para: Mark the con rod bodies and caps in relation to the cylinders using an indelible marker pen (cylinder 1 flywheel end).
Mark the con rod caps in relation to their bodies using an indelible pen.
Remove:

ul.li: the nuts or bolts of the con rod cap,
the marked con rod cap,
the con rod cap bearing shell while marking its position in relation to the con rod cap.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid any risk of cut, wear protective gloves during the operation.
reusenote.para: To avoid any risk of cut, wear protective gloves during the operation.

procstep.para: Remove:

ul.li: the "con rod - piston" assembly through the cylinder head side of the cylinder block,
the con rod body bearing.

procstep.para: Mark the bearing shell in relation to the con rod body using an indelible marker pen.
Repeat the above operations on the other cylinders.

procedure.title: Piston ring removal operation

procstep.para: Operation only to be carried out when replacing or checking the piston rings piston - con rod : checkGIEMR-001761.
Remove the piston rings using a piston ring compressor.

noteR.para: Take care not to damage the piston when removing the rings. Do not open the rings too much as they risk becoming damaged.
If reusing, mark the piston rings in relation to the piston.

procedure.title: Operation to separate the con rod and piston

procstep.para: Operation only to be carried out when replacing or checking the piston or con rod piston - con rod : checkGIEMR-001761.

procedure.title: Operation to separate the con rod and piston

noteR.para: The gudgeon pins are tight in the con rods and are able to rotate in the pistons.

procstep.para: Using an indelible marker pen, mark the position of the piston in relation to the cylinder and the gudgeon pin in relation to the piston.
Use tool kit Tooling for replacing gudgeon pins.Mot.574-22.
Place the piston on the base 1.
Align the gudgeon pin with the base clearance hole.
Remove the gudgeon pin using the press and the extraction pin 2.
Repeat the above operations for the other pistons.

procedure.title: Operation to separate the con rod and piston

noteR.para: The gudgeon pins are fitted so that they are free to turn in the pistons and con rods.

procstep.para: Remove:

ul.li: the locking spring ring located next to the "V" engraved on the piston crown,
the gudgeon pin,
the con rod,
the locking spring ring located opposite the" V" engraved on the piston crown.

procedure.title: refitting
refitting preparation operation

procstep.para: con rod cap bolts.

noteR.para: Wear goggles with side protectors for this operation.
Do not knock or lean against the cap mating faces and the con rod body to prevent damaging the con rod.

procstep.para: Clean the "piston - con rod" assembly with Surface Cleaner vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.
Dry the "piston - con rod" assembly using a compressed air nozzle.

procedure.title: Con rod bearing shells fitting operation

procstep.para: The con rods are fitted with bearing shells without a fool proofing device.
The bearing shells must be fitted using tool Tool for fitting main bearing shells.Mot.1492.
Select the bearing shell support 3 for the engine (engine type marked 4 on the support).
Slide the bearing shell support into the groove 5 on the base.
Fit the con rod into the base.
Press the lower section 6 of the small end against the centring pin.
Position the bearing shell 7 on the bearing shell support.
Push the bearing shell support (in the direction of the arrow) until the bearing shell support is fully inserted in the body of the connecting rod.
Remove the con rod body support and then repeat the operation for the other con rods.
Rest the con rod cap against the base plate pins 8.
Position the bearing shell 9 on the bearing shell support.
Push the bearing shell support (in the direction of the arrow) until the bearing shell support is fully inserted in the con rod cap.
Remove the con rod cap support and repeat the operation for the remaining con rod caps.

procedure.title: Piston and con rod assembly operation

procstep.para: If the piston is replaced, it is essential to check the pairing between the category of piston and that of the cylinder block barrel cylinder block: checkGIEMR-000478.
If a piston is reused, check that the piston/con rod marks made by the operator during disassembly match.

procedure.title: Piston and con rod assembly operation

procstep.para: Operation only to be carried out when replacing or checking the piston or con rod piston - con rod : checkGIEMR-001761.

The gudgeon pins are tight in the con rods and are able to rotate in the pistons. Use the kit Tooling for replacing gudgeon pins.Mot.574-22 and the Shaft A13-01, replaces shaft A13 for fitting gudgeon pins (E7-K7-K4 engine).Mot.574-24.

procedure.title: Preparing the con rods

procstep.para: Visually inspect:

ul.li: the condition of the con rods (torsion and squaring),
the cleanliness of the con rod cap and body bearing surfaces.

procstep.para: Use a 1500 W heating plate.
Put the small ends on the heating plate.
Ensure that the whole small end surface is in contact with the plate.
On each small end, solder on (as a temperature indicator) a piece of self-flux tin at10 with a melting point of approximately250˚C.
Heat the small end until the self-flux solder melts.

procedure.title: Preparing the gudgeon pins

procstep.para: Check that the gudgeon pins slide freely into the corresponding new pistons.

Use the centring device C13 and the fitting shaft A13 from kit Tooling for replacing gudgeon pins.Mot.574-22 for gudgeon pins without shoulders or the centring device C13and the fitting shaft A13-01 of tool Shaft A13-01, replaces shaft A13 for fitting gudgeon pins (E7-K7-K4 engine).Mot.574-24 for gudgeon pins with shoulders.
Fit the gudgeon pin 11 onto the fitting shaft 12.
Screw in the centring device 13 until the assembly locks.
Loosen by a quarter of a turn fitting shaft 12.

procedure.title: Direction of fitting for pistons in relation to con rods

procstep.para: Position the "V" 14 etched on the piston crown pointing upwards.
Position the con rod bearing shell lock pin 15 facing downwards.

procedure.title: Follow these instructions when assembling the piston and con rod:

procstep.para: Position ring 16 B10 on the base, and press the piston against the ring (pointing in the right direction), the assembly secured by the stirrup 17.
Check carefully that the gudgeon pin hole is aligned with ring B10.

procedure.title: Assembly of the piston and con rod

procstep.para: Lubricate the locator and gudgeon pin with engine oil.
Drive the gudgeon pin into the assembly to check that it can slide freely, and re-centre the piston if necessary.
The following operations should be carried out quickly to prevent heat loss.

noteR.para: Wear heat protective gloves during the operation.

procstep.para: When the solder reaches welding point (becomes liquid):

ul.li: wipe off the solder,
insert the locator into the piston,
insert the con rod (correctly positioned) in the piston,
quickly drive in the gudgeon pin until the locator reaches the end of the support base.

procstep.para: Ensure that the gudgeon pin remains withdrawn from the piston diameter for all con rod positions in the piston.

procedure.title: Piston and con rod assembly operation

noteR.para: The gudgeon pins are fitted so that they are free to turn in the pistons and con rods.

procstep.para: Refit a locking spring ring in the piston groove towards the top of the "V" engraved on the piston crown: the opening of the ring should be placed opposite the removal - refitting groove with a tolerance of ± 45˚.
Position:

ul.li: the "V" 18 engraved on the piston crown downwards,
the boss 19 of the con rod body upwards.

procstep.para: Lubricate the gudgeon pin with engine oil.
Manually push the gudgeon pin fully onto the ring already fitted.
Refit the second locking spring ring at the top of the piston. with the opening of the ring positioned opposite the removal - refitting groove with a tolerance of± 45˚.

procedure.title: Piston ring refitting operation

procstep.para: Operation only to be carried out when replacing or checking the piston rings piston - con rod : checkGIEMR-001761.
Rings set to their original settings must be free within their channels.
Respect the piston ring fitting direction, with TOP at the top.
Refit the piston rings using a piston ring compressor.
Observe the gap and direction of fitting for each piston ring.

procedure.title: refitting operation for piston - con rod assembly

procstep.para: Use SURFACE CLEANER vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 to degrease the mating faces of the "con rod cap - body"20.
Using engine oil, lubricate the tops of the cylinders and the crankshaft crankpins.
Refit the "con rod/piston" assemblies using the piston mounting ring(turning the piston marking towards the flywheel), ensuring that the pistons and cylinders match.
Fit the con rods onto the crankshaft crankpins.
Refit:

ul.li: the con rod caps,
the new bolts or new nuts of the con rod caps.

procedure.title: refitting operation for piston - con rod assembly
Standard con rod

procstep.para: Torque and angle tighten the con rod cap nuts20N.m110˚ ± 6°.

procedure.title: Divisible con rod

procstep.para: Torque and angle tighten the con rod cap bolts20N.m45˚ ± 6°.

procedure.title: refitting operation for piston - con rod assembly

procstep.para: Torque and angle tighten the con rod cap nuts20N.m110˚ ± 6°.
